title: Container ship runs aground in Suez Canal causing traffic jam
description: Seven tug boats have come to the aid of a container ship that ran aground in the Suez Canal on Tuesday and blocked other vessels from transiting one of the world's most important waterways.

title: Coming soon: Smart tires that could help you drive better
description: We tend to think of tires as big circular hunks of black rubber that just roll down the road. We don't think about them much until something goes wrong and you're stuck waiting for roadside assistance or digging the spare out of the trunk.

title: 'Shame, shame, shame': Tempers flare in Senate voting hearing
description: Senate Majority Leader Chuck Schumer and Senate Minority Leader Mitch McConnell clashed over sweeping voting rights legislation that would set federal standards on early and mail-in voting, and expand access to the polls.

title: New video appears to show attack on slain officer during Capitol riot
description: CNN's Evan Perez reports on new video obtained by The New York Times that appears to show an attack on slain officer Brian Sicknick during the January 6 Capitol riot.

title: Cinnamon Toast Crunch can't turn shrimp tail saga into a 'positive', professor says
description: Disgusting. That's what everyone thought when they first heard about the saga of the cinnamon-and-sugar encrusted shrimp tail found in a box of Cinnamon Toast Crunch.

title: EU proposes vaccine controls as 'raid' in Italy uncovers millions of AstraZeneca doses
description: The European Union proposed tighter controls on the export of Covid-19 vaccine doses on Wednesday, marking the latest spat between the bloc and the British-Swedish drugmaker AstraZeneca.

title: Questions about AstraZeneca's vaccine? We asked a top WHO scientist
description: The World Health Organization's chief scientist Dr. Soumya Swaminathan responds recent criticism of the AstraZeneca Covid-19 vaccine by saying a team of top scientists approved the vaccine because its efficacy far outweighed any risks.

title: Bernie Sanders doesn't 'feel comfortable' about Twitter's permanent ban against Trump
description: Independent Sen. Bernie Sanders denounced former President Donald Trump in strong terms in an interview released Tuesday but said Twitter's permanent suspension of the former Republican president doesn't sit right with him.

title: Former Trump lawyer's defense in defamation suit could put her in legal jeopardy
description: Sidney Powell, President Donald Trump's former lawyer, filed an eye-popping brief this week that could potentially doom her chances of dismissing a $1.3 billion defamation suit and provide ammunition in a separate lawsuit seeking her disbarment.

title: CNN anchor presses GOP lawmaker about stance on gun reform bills
description: CNN's Poppy Harlow speaks to Rep. Don Bacon (R-NE) about gun reform bills that passed the House, in wake of the supermarket shooting in Boulder, Colorado, that left 10 people dead.

title: Biden has left Trump's China tariffs in place. Here's why
description: Former President Donald Trump started a controversial trade war with China three years ago, putting tariffs on roughly $350 billion of Chinese-made goods -- and despite the change in administration, those duties remain in place.

title: Biden assigns Harris to lead diplomatic efforts to stem crisis at US-Mexico border
description: President Joe Biden is tasking Vice President Kamala Harris with overseeing efforts with Central American countries to stem the flow of migrants to the US southern border, senior administration officials said on Wednesday, the first major issue Biden has assigned directly to his No. 2.

title: It's Equal Pay Day: Women lose an average of $406,000 to the wage gap in their lifetime
description: This year, Equal Pay Day falls on March 24, a date that symbolizes how far into the year women must work to earn the same as men did in the previous year.

title: Video shows devastation after deadly fire in refugee camp
description: A fire swept through a Rohingya refugee camp in Cox's Bazar, Bangladesh, leaving multiple people dead and hundreds more injured.

title: German Catholic clergy rebel against Vatican over same-sex unions
description: German Catholic theologians and clergy have mobilized against a recent ruling from the Vatican that said the Catholic Church would not bless same-sex unions.

title: $62M auction puts British painter among world's most valuable living artists
description: The world's largest canvas painting has sold at a Dubai auction for almost 228 million dirham ($62 million), putting it among the most expensive artworks ever to go under the hammer.

title: This US city is giving low-income families of color $500 a month, no strings attached
description: Low-income families of color in Oakland, California, could receive some extra financial assistance over the next year and a half.

title: Republicans and Democrats have found one thing they can all rally around
description: A bipartisan group of senators is pushing to pass legislation as soon as next month to try to rein in China's economic influence on the United States, in an effort that represents President Joe Biden's best chance at a major bipartisan package from Congress.

title: Water cascades down Uluru after heavy rains batter northern Australia
description: After heavy rains battered northern Australia for almost a week, stunning footage has emerged of waterfalls at Uluru, the sacred sandstone monolith in the desert plains of the Northern Territory's "Red Centre."

title: Venice and Florence demand a halt to Airbnb
description: Tourists sprawled over sidewalks, garbage piled up in the streets, and thousands-strong lines to enter museums. Overtourism feels a long time ago now, but the after effects are still being felt in Italian cities, where locals have been squeezed out by Airbnbs, businesses have been drowned out by souvenir shops, and whole economies have been hijacked by tourism, and then hung out to dry.

title: Tencent's profits are soaring. But investors are worried about a crackdown by China
description: Tencent just posted a huge jump in profits, but that won't stop investors from fretting over whether it'll become the next big target of a clampdown by regulators on tech companies in China.

title: Prince Harry joins the Aspen Institute's fight against misinformation
description: Voicing concern about an "avalanche of misinformation" in the digital world, Prince Harry is joining the Aspen Institute's new Commission on Information Disorder as a commissioner.

title: Ingenuity helicopter carried a piece of Wright brothers history to Mars
description: The Ingenuity Mars helicopter is carrying a piece of history. A postage stamp-size piece of muslin fabric that covered one of the wings from the Wright brothers' Flyer is attached to a cable beneath the helicopter's solar panel.

title: Elon Musk is trying to win China back
Six Bulgarians charged with helping Russia steal NATO secrets in espionage 'unparalleled since 1944'
description: Secretly shot video tells the story of an alleged spy ring at work in Bulgaria's capital.

title: See groom accidentally drop ring into lake during wedding
description: A scuba diver emerged as a hero after a groom accidentally dropped a ring into Lake Tahoe during his wedding ceremony.

title: Boris Johnson's latest gaffe could threaten vaccine rollout
description: Boris Johnson, the UK's gaffe-prone Prime Minister, is making frantic attempts to row back on comments made in a private meeting with lawmakers from his own Conservative party on Tuesday night.

title: Kenya orders closure of two refugee camps, gives ultimatum to UN agency
description: Kenya on Wednesday ordered the closure of two sprawling camps that host hundreds of thousands of refugees from neighboring Somalia and gave the UN refugee agency (UNHCR) two weeks to present a plan to do so, the interior ministry said.

title: Queen Elizabeth II's granddaughter gives birth on the bathroom floor
description: Britain's Queen Elizabeth II has a new great-grandson, after her eldest granddaughter, Zara Tindall, gave birth at home on Sunday evening.

title: Niger mourns 137 victims after deadliest attack in recent memory
description: Flags flew at half-staff and Koranic verses played on state media on Tuesday as Niger began observing three days of national mourning for the 137 victims of coordinated raids on villages in the southwest.

title: Myanmar protesters join 'silent strike' after soldiers kill 7-year-old girl in her father's arms
Conservatives with high expectations anxious for Justice Amy Coney Barrett to show her hand
description: Some conservatives who pushed and prodded for the Senate to quickly confirm Amy Coney Barrett to succeed the late Justice Ruth Bader Ginsburg on the Supreme Court last fall are rattled by what they have seen so far.

title: America's Black community calls for vaccine equity
description: CNN's Amara Walker reports from Birmingham, Alabama, where the number vaccines administered is disproportionate by race according to Alabama's Department of Public Health.

title: Myanmar soldiers kill girl, 7, in father's arms
description:
•  Terrified and uncertain, these families crossed mountains to escape Myanmar's deadly junta
• Journalist released from detention in Myanmar

title: Kamala Harris gives fiery response on gun reform
description: Vice President Kamala Harris called on the Senate to take action on gun control during an interview on "CBS This Morning."

title: You can now use bitcoin to buy a Tesla
description: Bitcoin fans looking for ways to spend their cryptocurrency fortunes can add a big ticket item to the list: a Tesla.

title: Lessons I've learned as a Black traveler
description: Traveling has given me a stable sense of identity. It's a form of escape where I feel most confident, at peace and like myself.

title: One woman was in a tattoo shop in the same shopping center when she heard about four gunshots. Within minutes, there was chaos.
description: Live updates: The investigation | Victim info | Gun policy

title: Actor George Segal has died at age 87
description: George Segal, the prolific actor with a career that spanned more than six decades, has died at age 87, his wife said Tuesday.

title: Putin gets coronavirus vaccine behind closed doors
'Run, run, run!' Witnesses detail how the Boulder shooting unfolded
Hear from three survivors of three Colorado mass shootings
description: CNN's Anderson Cooper talks to three survivors of three mass shootings in Colorado: the Columbine shooting, the Aurora theater shooting and the Boulder supermarket shooting.

title: Nearly twice as many unaccompanied migrant children apprehended daily at US-Mexico border as at 2019 peak
description: US border officials are detaining on average more than 600 unaccompanied migrant children who cross the US-Mexico border each day, a Department of Homeland Security official familiar with the data told CNN.

title: Here's what we know about the mass shooting suspect
description: Ahmad Al Aliwi Alissa was identified by authorities Tuesday as the gunman who opened fire at a King Soopers grocery store in Colorado, killing 10 people, including a Boulder police officer.

title: A young grocery store manager. A father of seven. They were among the victims in Boulder
description: Rikki Olds was a vivacious, strong, and independent young woman who worked as a front-end manager at a King Soopers grocery store.
